sen.e: His father TAIRA no Tadayori, who was Mutsu no kuni no suke (officer in charge of regional administration in Mutsu), was an ancestor of Boso-Heishi (Taira clan).

sen.e: His grandfather TAIRA no Yoshifumi settled in Muraoka, Musashi Province and called himself Goro MURAOKA, who possessed shoryo (territory) in the greater part of Soma County, Shimousa Province.

sen.e: His father Tadayori was also renowned as a powerful samurai in Kanto region.

sen.j: 忠常は祖父と父の地盤を引き継ぎ、常陸国、上総国、下総国に広大な所領を有した。
sen.e: Tadatsune took over the sphere of influence built by his grandfather and father and possessed a vast shoryo in Hitachi Province, Kazusa Province and Shimousa Province.

sen.e: Tadatsune behaved outrageously against the background of the mighty military power and it is said he did not even pay his taxes, disobeyed kokushi (provincial governors).

sen.e: Since Tadatsune's troops had been exhausted from a long battle, he entered into priesthood with a posthumous Buddhist name Tsuneyasu in Spring of 1031, and then went before Yorinobu to surrender taking his two children and his followers.
